pr_title: PHOENIX-6198 Add option to IndexTool to specify the source table for scan

timeline.message: PHOENIX-6198 Add option to IndexTool to specify the source table for scan

timeline.bodyText: nit: We have a similar enum in the IndexScrutinyTool. Can we re use it?
timeline.author: gokceni

replies.bodyText: It has a BOTH option which is not supported that is why I didn't want to use it.
replies.author: tkhurana

replies.bodyText: I agree with Gokcen, does not hurt to use it. In the future, we may want to use both. Would be a good extension.
replies.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: I think stating this is clearer: This option is applicable only when -v ONLY or -v BEFORE is provided.
timeline.author: gokceni

timeline.message:
Addressed feedback for PHOENIX-6198

Extended the `-from-index` option to support -vBOTH, -vAFTER and -vNONE.
Added the disclaimer for -vAFTER. Also, using the source table enum from
IndexScrutinyTool.

timeline.author: priyankporwal

replies.bodyText: By default, we are going to use the data table as the source which is what the current behavior is. We have to return a string from which the appropriate enum is constructed. I am not sure what is the question here.
replies.author: tkhurana
